required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oral and Non-insulin Injected Hypoglycemic Therapy Utilization Patterns
clinical_study.official_title: A Description of Oral and Non-insulin Injected Hypoglycemic Therapy Utilization Patterns Including Initiation, Switching, and Discontinuation

brief_summary.textblock:
This protocol is for a series of descriptive analyses conducted within a cohort of patients using linagliptin, other dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitors, and other oral and non-insulin injected hypoglycemic medications between May 2011 and July 2012.
Understanding 1) the existing utilization patterns for linagliptin, sitagliptin, saxagliptin, and other oral and non-insulin injected hypoglycemic agents and (2) the differences in utilization patterns between these agents will help with the design, analysis and interpretation of comparative effectiveness and safety studies of linagliptin, other DPP-4 inhibitors, and other agents.
The study will provide an overview of existing utilization patterns for linagliptin, other dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitors, other oral and non-insulin injected hypoglycemic agents, in order to detect potential selective prescribing patterns that might lead to channeling bias.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Initiators for United Healthcare Patients
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients initiating each individual agent divided by the number of patients initiating any oral or non-insulin injected hypoglycemic agent.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Initiators for MarketScan Patients
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients initiating each individual agent divided by the number of patients initiating any oral or non-insulin injected hypoglycemic agent.

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Switching for United Healthcare Patients
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with dispensing of a new non-insulin hypoglycemic agent without subsequent to the end of days' supply of the original agent plus 30 days
Number of patients with dispensing of a new non-insulin hypoglycemic agent without subsequent to the end of days' supply of the original agent plus 30 days

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Augmentation for United Healthcare Patients
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients dispensing of a new non-insulin hypoglycemic agent while continuing to fill prescriptions for the initial therapy
Number of patients dispensing of a new non-insulin hypoglycemic agent while continuing to fill prescriptions for the initial therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Subsequent Insulin Initiation for United Healthcare Patients
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients filling an insulin prescription subsequently to initiation of the original non-insulin agent without having filled one in the past 6 months

primary_outcome.measure: Subsequent Insulin Initiation for MarketScan Patients
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients filling an insulin prescription subsequently to initiation of the original non-insulin agent without having filled one in the past 6 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment Discontinuation for United Healthcare Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with a treatment gap of >=6 months (i.e., no dispensing of non-insulin hypoglycemic agents within 6 months after the end of days supplied)
Number of patients with a treatment gap of >=6 months (i.e., no dispensing of non-insulin hypoglycemic agents within 6 months after the end of days supplied)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Days Covered for United Healthcare Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days supply dispensed divided by number of days followed

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Days Covered for MarketScan Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days supply dispensed divided by number of days followed

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence at 3 Months for United Healthcare Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Fraction of non-insulin hypoglycemic initiators with continued dispensing. Patients will be classified as persistent if they possess medication at 3 months. Grace period of 30 days will be allowed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence at 6 Months for United Healthcare Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Fraction of non-insulin hypoglycemic initiators with continued dispensing. Patients will be classified as persistent if they possess medication at 6 months. Grace period of 30 days will be allowed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence at 12 Months for United Healthcare Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Fraction of non-insulin hypoglycemic initiators with continued dispensing. Patients will be classified as persistent if they possess medication at 12 months. Grace period of 30 days will be allowed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence at 3 Months for MarketScan Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Fraction of non-insulin hypoglycemic initiators with continued dispensing. Patients will be classified as persistent if they possess medication at 3 months. Grace period of 30 days will be allowed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence at 6 Months for MarketScan Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Fraction of non-insulin hypoglycemic initiators with continued dispensing. Patients will be classified as persistent if they possess medication at 6 months. Grace period of 30 days will be allowed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Persistence at 12 Months for MarketScan Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Fraction of non-insulin hypoglycemic initiators with continued dispensing. Patients will be classified as persistent if they possess medication at 12 months. Grace period of 30 days will be allowed.

study_pop.textblock: T2DM patients aged 18 years or older, initiating antidiabetic treatment after at least 6 months of continuous enrollment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus
- a dispensing of an oral or non-insulin injected hypoglycemic medication between May 2011 and June 2012
- at least 6 months enrolment in the database preceding the date of the first dispensing
Exclusion criteria:
- age < 18
- missing or ambiguous age or sex information
- at least one diagnosis of type 1 diabetes mellitus or secondary diabetes

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Existing data cohort design using data from the United Healthcare and MarketScan databases from May 2011 through July 2012

group.title: United Healthcare
group.description: Patients using an oral and non-insulin injected glucose-lowering medication identified from the United Healthcare Research database

group.description: Patients using an oral and non-insulin injected glucose-lowering medication identified from the MarketScan database.

reported_events.desc: Serious and other (non-serious) adverse events were not of interest in this study and therefore were not collected or assessed as part of the study, in addition individual patient data is not available therefore adverse event data is not presented.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BIs intellectual property rights.
